dkeep.logic

Class Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Key
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Key
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Key(int x, int y, char symbol)
      The used constructor of an object of type key the constructor sets the found flag to its default false because when its created the key is not yet found by the hero

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getFound()
      Gets the variable that shows if the key has been found
      boolean getIsaKey()
      The key can work differently in the various levels, it can work as key itself and as a lever,this function return the flag that represents that
      char getSymbol()
      Gets the key representation in the map
      int getX()
      Gets the x position of the key
      int getY()
      Gets the y position of the key
      boolean isOnTop(int xPos, int yPos)
      Checks if ,the key has not been already found, the key is at the given position
      void setFound()
      Sets the found variable to true and the key symbol to ' ' so that means that the key has been found by the hero ( this is only useful when the key is really a key and not a lever)
      void setIsaKey(boolean value)
      Sets the IsaKey value to the given parameter (IsaKey is a flag that checks if the key is really a key or just a lever)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Key

        public Key(int x,
           int y,
           char symbol)
        The used constructor of an object of type key the constructor sets the found flag to its default false because when its created the key is not yet found by the hero
        Parameters:
        x - the x position on the matrix -Line
        y - the y position on the matrix - Column
        symbol - the represent key in the matrix - 'k' is default

    • Method Detail

      • getIsaKey

        public boolean getIsaKey()
        The key can work differently in the various levels, it can work as key itself and as a lever,this function return the flag that represents that
        Returns:
        false if the key flag is false( if its a lever) or true if it is really a key

      • setIsaKey

        public void setIsaKey(boolean value)
        Sets the IsaKey value to the given parameter (IsaKey is a flag that checks if the key is really a key or just a lever)
        Parameters:
        value - the new value of IsaKey

      • getFound

        public boolean getFound()
        Gets the variable that shows if the key has been found
        Returns:
        found variable

      • setFound

        public void setFound()
        Sets the found variable to true and the key symbol to ' ' so that means that the key has been found by the hero ( this is only useful when the key is really a key and not a lever)

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Gets the x position of the key
        Returns:
        the x variable

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Gets the y position of the key
        Returns:
        the y variable

      • isOnTop

        public boolean isOnTop(int xPos,
                       int yPos)
        Checks if ,the key has not been already found, the key is at the given position
        Parameters:
        xPos - position to compare to the x of the key
        yPos - position to compare to the y of the key
        Returns:
        true if the given position corresponds to the key position(and key is not yet found) otherwise returns false

      • getSymbol

        public char getSymbol()
        Gets the key representation in the map
        Returns:
        the symbol variable
